article.description:
Warren McLendon scored 24 points and had eight rebounds as The Citadel handed winless Savannah State its
20th loss of the season Monday night, 70-47.
article.headline: The Citadel keeps Tigers as only winless D-I team
article.linkText: Lonely at bottom: Savannah State drops to 0-20
article.story: SAVANNAH, Ga. (AP) -- Warren McLendon scored 24 points and had eight rebounds as The Citadel handed winless Savannah State its 20th loss of the season Monday night, 70-47. Don McLendon, who added 15 points for The Citadel (10-3), hit a 3-pointer 25 seconds into the game, and the Bulldogs never trailed. The tightest margin, 7-4, came at 15:30 of the first half after a 3-pointer by Mark Williams and a 3-pointer by Donald Carson of Savannah State erased a 7-0 deficit. Williams, who with Carson led the Tigers with 15 points, scored the last three points of the half as The Citadel took a 35-18 lead into intermission. The Bulldogs expanded their advantage through the second half. The widest margin was 31 points, 66-35, after a layup by Travis Smith. Savannah State is the last remaining winless team in Division I.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
